turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I ain't trying to get in it.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You better stop running from that girl.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I know we cousins and all, but don't try an' hook me up with the big little sisters.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Big bitches need love, too, Craig.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I didn't think you smoked bud that much.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You better open up a window or something before the smell gets out.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: This vacuum don't work.  Where's the restroom?

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Out the door and to the left.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Craig, what the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Naw.  I bet'cha it's something better than air.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: How you know?  It could be anything.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I don't know, and it could be anything. But I just say we go take a look.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Man, I don't think I can do this, Craig. I got the B-G's.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: The bubble guts.  I'm so nervous it feels like I'mma shit on myself.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: You make it sound so easy.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: It is easy. You know why?  'Cause they're not expecting it. Now, Roach, you gotta occupy Cheeco. Long enough for me and Day-Day to take a good look.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Day-Day, if you don't hop that fence I'mma throw you over.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: I ain't scared of you.  We ain't little no more.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: I hope to God that dog is happy.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: That pump was full of money.  I saw where they put it.  Stay right here, I'mma climb in and go get it.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Wait here?  So Cheeco can bite my ass off?  Tell me where it is I'll do it.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: You sure you don't wanna stay?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Naw, I'm got live ghetto fabulous.  make sure you get that car fixed.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: I will.  When can I come visit?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I don't know.  Probably next Friday.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Craig and Karla, damn that sound pretty good together.  Where you going?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: My brothers won't give me a ride.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You want us to give you a ride?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: What you mean, you don't know?  Just wait here.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I'm sorry for what my brother did this morning.  They're assholes.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: It's cool.  You ain't got to apologize for your brothers.  They're big boys.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I just wanted to give you this.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I hope you don't think I'm crazy, but I just had to come in here and show you I ain't scared of yo' punk ass brothers...and you wouldn't have be scared of 'em neither if you had a man like me in yo' life.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: What??  So you snuck in my room to tell me that?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: You did all this for me?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Most of it.  I just hate to see you in this situation.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Thanks for noticing.  It used ta be peaceful before they got out.  Took over the house and caused my mother's nervous breakdown.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Easier said than done.  We saved up to get away from them, but they followed us.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I did.  Is that door locked?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I got my cousin Day-Day waiting for me.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Yeah, I'm cool.  See you later.

turns.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
turns.text: Could you hurry up, please... it's kinda hot out here.

turns.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
turns.text: Nice house. Didn't expect you to answer. You must be one of those entertainers. What team you play for?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I don't play for no team.

turns.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
turns.text: Come on, jerky, you can tell me.  Got a white wife, huh?  Blonde bombshell type. Remember what happen to O.J... what team do you play for?  You're not related to the Jacksons, are you?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Naw, I play for the Chocamunga Cracker Killers.  You want tickets?

turns.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
turns.text: Okay, buddy.  Don't send your entourage out here to do a 187 on me.  It's just a certified mail delivery.

turns.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
turns.text: Delinquent Property Tax Notice... I hope the Cracker Killers pay well 'cause if not, back to the ghetto you go.  Wife stays here, of course.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'll be out in about 35-40 minutes!

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Hurry up; today is Fri-day!  And we gotta hit the high-way!

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: I fell in some mud.  Now hurry up!

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: That nigga worst than them damn pit bulldogs or something!  That's why moving wit'cha Uncle Elroy and Cousin Day-Day is the best thing for you right now.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Ya'll making me look like a punk.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: It ain't about being a punk, son.  It's about this...

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Must be your upper lip, 'cause I don't smell nothing.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Smells like you didn't fall in no mud.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: I gotta get'em fixed.  They don't roll down.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: 18-years of chasing dogs; and my lazy ass brother hits the lotto his first time playing.  I still can't figure that one out.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Why they got to have the loudest house on the block!

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: No, I'mma go on to work.  I don't wanna hear Elroy's mouth.  Now listen to me, Craig.  It's gonna be different living over here.  Don't let your uncle and your cousin get you into no shit.  Understand?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Hey, Pops, I'm grown.  Can't nobody get me in trouble no more.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Craig, remember what I told you.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Hold up, Elroy, that's my boy.  Craig, what the hell wrong with you?  Where you been?

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Two bullets?  Yo' ass ain't changed. Back in the day, all I had was a stick.

turns.speaker: MR. JONES
turns.text: Nigga, you got knock the fuck out.

turns.speaker: MISS HO KYM
turns.text: My name is Miss Ho Kym.  Day-Day just trying to be a smart ass.  Nice to meet you, Craig.  Are you 'bout it, 'bout it?

turns.speaker: MISS HO KYM
turns.text: I said...are you 'bout it, 'bout it -- rowdy, rowdy?

turns.speaker: MISS HO KYM
turns.text: Well, then, it's all good.  Yo, Day-Day, something is going down with those Mexicans across the street?  I've been seeing a lot of activity.

turns.speaker: MISS HO KYM
turns.text: Strange activity.  I think they running drugs off Tijuana.  Day-Day don't believe me.

turns.speaker: MISS HO KYM
turns.text: See you later, Day-Day.  Come by after work, I got the John Blaze shit for you.

turns.speaker: MISS HO KYM
turns.text: Why for?  Them boys are real player haters.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: It's a long story.  Right now we gotta do somethin'.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER #1
turns.text: I can't get jiggy with this shit.  Where is the damn manager?

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Sir, the manager stepped out for a moment.  I'm currently running the store. Can I see the CD?

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER #1
turns.text: No, give me my damn money back.  Right now, and I don't have no damn receipt neither.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER #1
turns.text: I don't have no damn cover.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: I can't give you your damn money back on this.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER #1
turns.text: Bullshit!  I'll go postal in this mothafucka!

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Well, you gonna have to go postal then.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Look, Roach, I know you ain't never worked in a record shop before and you're a little excited.  But if Pinky catches you doing that X-Games shit off his counter top, we both getting fired.  You feel me?

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: I feel you.  I've just been practicing that one move all week.  I thought that was it.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: Did you see that?  That was a W.W.F. hit right there, huh, Day-Day?

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Yeah, it was.  How you get up here?

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Craig, this Roach.  Roach, this is my cousin, Craig.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Ever since my momma died the bills are always late.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Don't worry about it, man.  Get the phone.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: You damn right that's the big one.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: Bummer, huh?  And Friday is suppose to be a kick-ass day.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Damn nigga, don't Jack the joint.  I didn't even pass it.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: I gotta think of a plan to get this money before tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: I don't know.  I hope Craig got a good idea.  We gotta ask him when he comes out.  Let's go and clean up before Pinky gets here.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: Maybe you can ask him to loan you the money.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Yoooo, that's it.  You ain't as dumb as I think you are, Roach.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: Who the fuck is that, Day-Day?

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Let it go, Roach, trust me.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: I'm not letting nothing go.  They killed my board.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: I say we go over there and kick their asses.  I can take the little one.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Are you out your mind?  I'm not messing with them S.A.'s boy.  You must be crazy.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: Try an' hold it, man.  Squeeze your ass cheeks together.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Butterflies, my ass.  I'm about to go home.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: Why did he go in the house?

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  We gotta figure out a way to get Craig out of there. He's probably getting tied up now.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: 'Scuse me, partner, but that's a ghetto knock.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Look, man, this is a big misunderstanding.  All we wanted to do is borrow some sugar.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: ...and some rolling papers, that's it. We didn't mean to mess up y'all get together or nothing.  How y'all doing?

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Money?  Man, we came over here from some sugar and rolling papers.  We was going to get high, and I was going to show this white boy how to make Kool-Aid.  That's all.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: Hey, mister Joker, have a heart, bro. It's Friday.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Finally you got a bitch, huh, Roach?

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: Hey, man, the pleasure's all mine. Thanks for the dog, and the money.  Maybe my dad won't kick my ass tonight.

turns.speaker: ROACH
turns.text: Okay, later, bro.  Hey, Craig, nice smokin' wit'cha.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Wet your eyes, boy.  Stay in there for about 20 minutes.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: Yeah, 20 minutes.  Trust me.  I've been pepper sprayed nine times.  20 minutes.

turns.speaker: UNCLE ELROY
turns.text: When my back gets better I'mma beat the black off you, Day-Day.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: What the fuck you looking at?

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Uh...um...I mean uh, can we borrow a cup of sugar?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: What?!  This look like a 7-11 or something?  Get the fuck outta here!

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Shut up!  Both of you right now!

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Shhhh!  Roach, shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: I don't believe this sugar shit. Something ain't right.

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Why would he take it?  He don't even know you.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Shut up!  Where's that other miyatea?

turns.speaker: DAY-DAY
turns.text: Joker, a man like yourself can do a lot for this community.  By letting us go, you can improve black and brown relations.

turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: He moved out to Rancho Cucamonga with his cousin Day-Day.

turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: Man, we can't ride to Rancho Cucamonga on that.

turns.speaker: DEBO
turns.text: Here's the plan.  You gonna call over there and say you have a very urgent message for Mr. William Jones.

turns.speaker: DEBO
turns.text: If you shut up I'll tell you.  The urgent message is...Drop everything!  Craig is in trouble.  Come quick, don't call.

turns.speaker: EZAL
turns.text: Yeah, I got a urgent message for a customer named William Jones.  Drop everything, Craig is in trouble.  Come quick.  Don't try to call.
